>Four of my last five posts do not show up to *anybody*, because I posted in guilds like +Freemasonry trying to help the newbie guildmaster get his guild more active. >Here's the problem with your dumbshit mandatory-Categorization idea, +tennis adopted it and thus I can get karma and attract discussion if I post there, but +Golf has a barely-active GM and somebody asking for months for it to be replaced but the 12 members there are also inactive...it won't ever grow because even if I post a great story there, it won't be shown on All/Trending, so nobody sees it, nobody joins it, nobody becomes GM of it

>In "extra-Reddity" ways, it doesn't even just try to hide porn or even "hatespeech", it literally just hides things posted to +Golf or +Iran or +Browncoats or +ItsOkayToBeMale because they're run by lackadaisical GMs or don't have GMs...and will never attract GMs, since even if I go post in +Golf to get great conversations going, sharing my own photos, ranking courses, etc...none of you will ever see it on All/Trending and think "oh neat, a golf guild".

Don't remove all possible purpose to ordinary users posting in +Iran or +Golf or +Dolphins just because they aren't modded by the right power-mods.

I'd guess 90% of "[deleted user]" posts I see on Ruqqus are actually me...and on January 1st this one will say the same; the question is just whether I lose interest in continuing or not :P

Basically this rule, as it stands, will drastically increase the echo-chamber and reduce us to a few power-guilds while all of the old guilds with fewer than 500 members will not even be worth TRYING to build up unless you ARE the moderator. But if you're not the moderator, and nobody's a super-active mod who is changing settings (what percentage of guilds even have a banner set?) then there's no point even POSTING in it.

>Four of my last five posts do not show up to *anybody*, because I posted in guilds like +Freemasonry trying to help the newbie guildmaster get his guild more active. My most recent post was actually quite a good one, I expected it to possibly hit "Trending" and score him a few new members based solely off the discussion it might bring.

It's extra-Reddity because they're just empowering a "super-user" class whose guilds will have value, and 90% of guilds will have no value and be unable to gain value even I make an effort to put some quality posts into them.

If you want it to be "mandatory", just make a dialogue box that will prompt the GM next time they log into the site, and provide them the dropdown menus to choose categories. Don't remove all possible purpose to ordinary users posting in +Iran or +Golf or +Dolphins just because they aren't modded by the right power-mods.

Basically this rule, as it stands, will drastically increase the echo-chamber and reduce us to a few power-guilds while all of the old guilds with fewer than 500 members will not even be worth TRYING to build up unless you ARE the moderator. But if you're not the moderator, and nobody's a super-active mod who is changing settings (what percentage of guilds even have a banner set?) then there's no point even POSTING in it.

At worst, it's outright censorship - at "best" it's an attempt to monetize the site for power-users to dominate the narrative. Either way, it's losing my interest quickly.

Great example of the censorship at work. So I have had to move it to +Defund_the_ATF despite clearly not fitting there, just because that's the only way THIS thread will ever be seen.
